result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John P Ballard

records.addlTxt:
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.H (person, property, residence or family).

AMENDED 9/16/2022: No violent contact with the victim J.H (person, property, residence or family). ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Emailed dispatch at 9:47 AM to cancel warrant.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:35 AM Defendant John P Ballard in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for John P Ballard.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a return on warrant
Defense provides reason for why the Defendant missed the last court appearance. Asks that bond is reinstated. Seeking that the no contact order is lifted in case 22CM533. 
State does not object to vacating the warrant or modifying the bond to no violent contact. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Bond conditions modified to no violent contact with J.H. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
